data.title: 6 Shahid Kapoor Films from His Chocolate Boy Era
data.text:
How old will you feel if we tell you that Shahid Kapoor’s debut film came out in 2003? Yes, you heard us right! Those were the days when every girl fangirled over him. His soft-boy phase made everyone fall for his charm. Let’s have a look at his six films where he played a chocolate boy.

Ishq Vishk

This film marked the beginning of his Bollywood journey as a lead hero. His sweet acts in this story melted many hearts, and the audience kept waiting for more on-screen appearances of him. His and Amrita Rao’s chemistry was loved by many, and they instantly became everyone’s favourite.

Image source: Film Companion

Deewane Huye Paagal

Shahid was seen in a story of star-studded madness. He played a lover boy named Karan Sharma who got stuck in the middle of a chaotic drama. He set an example of a caring boyfriend who went above and beyond to win his love.

Image source: X

36 China Town

There’s something with Shahid and an intriguing storyline! Playing Raj in this film, he kept the audience engaged in a thrilling murder mystery. In this journey to find the murderer, he falls for a girl named Priya and ends up with her after the case gets solved.

Image source: Bollywood Hungama

Chup Chup Ke

Just his expressions are enough to grab your attention. This film will prove why. He fakes his death to get away from heavy debt and plays a deaf and dumb person to begin a new chapter of his life. He will make you laugh, cry, and smile throughout this film.

Image source: IMDb

Vivah

We’ve all watched Vivah as our guilty pleasure. He meets a girl for an arranged marriage and takes us on a ride to experience what true love means. Although the couple faces an uncertain situation, they secure their relationship with affection.

Image source: News18

Jab We Met

Watching this masterpiece is never enough. He raised the bar of an ideal lover in the role of Aditya Kashyap in the film. He goes through a phase of realisation that true love exists, and it happens at an unexpected moment. The audience just cannot get enough of this movie.

Image source: ScoopWhoop
